intro: Leionema dentatum, commonly known as the toothed leionema, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalypts and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels. Leionema dentatum is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas.
